description: Manage Gmail end-to-end: send, draft, reply, forward, and bulk-modify or delete messages and threads. Organize your inbox with labels, archiving, and trashing, and retrieve messages, attachments, and profile details on demand. Access and search contacts to autofill recipients and keep people data in sync.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_ADD_LABEL_TO_EMAIL
capabilities.description: Adds and/or removes specified gmail labels for a message; ensure `message id` and all `label ids` are valid (use 'listlabels' for custom label ids).

capabilities.name: GMAIL_CREATE_EMAIL_DRAFT
capabilities.description: Creates a gmail email draft, supporting to/cc/bcc, subject, plain/html body (ensure `is html=true` for html), attachments, and threading.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_CREATE_LABEL
capabilities.description: Creates a new label with a unique name in the specified user's gmail account.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_DELETE_DRAFT
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes a specific gmail draft using its id; ensure the draft exists and the user has necessary permissions for the given `user id`.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_DELETE_MESSAGE
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes a specific email message by its id from a gmail mailbox; for `user id`, use 'me' for the authenticated user or an email address to which the authenticated user has delegated access.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_FETCH_EMAILS
capabilities.description: Fetches a list of email messages from a gmail account, supporting filtering, pagination, and optional full content retrieval.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_FETCH_MESSAGE_BY_MESSAGE_ID
capabilities.description: Fetches a specific email message by its id, provided the `message id` exists and is accessible to the authenticated `user id`.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_FETCH_MESSAGE_BY_THREAD_ID
capabilities.description: Retrieves messages from a gmail thread using its `thread id`, where the thread must be accessible by the specified `user id`.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_GET_ATTACHMENT
capabilities.description: Retrieves a specific attachment by id from a message in a user's gmail mailbox, requiring valid message and attachment ids.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_GET_CONTACTS
capabilities.description: Fetches contacts (connections) for the authenticated google account, allowing selection of specific data fields and pagination.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_GET_PEOPLE
capabilities.description: Retrieves either a specific person's details (using `resource name`) or lists 'other contacts' (if `other contacts` is true), with `person fields` specifying the data to return.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_GET_PROFILE
capabilities.description: Retrieves key gmail profile information (email address, message/thread totals, history id) for a user.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_LIST_DRAFTS
capabilities.description: Retrieves a paginated list of email drafts from a user's gmail account. use verbose=true to get full draft details including subject, body, sender, and timestamp.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_LIST_LABELS
capabilities.description: Retrieves a list of all system and user-created labels for the specified gmail account.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_LIST_THREADS
capabilities.description: Retrieves a list of email threads from a gmail account, identified by `user id` (email address or 'me'), supporting filtering and pagination.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_MODIFY_THREAD_LABELS
capabilities.description: Adds or removes specified existing label ids from a gmail thread, affecting all its messages; ensure the thread id is valid.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_MOVE_TO_TRASH
capabilities.description: Moves an existing, non-deleted email message to the trash for the specified user.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_PATCH_LABEL
capabilities.description: Patches the specified label.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_REMOVE_LABEL
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes a specific, existing user-created gmail label by its id for a user; cannot delete system labels.

capabilities.name: GMAIL_REPLY_TO_THREAD
capabilities.description: Sends a reply within a specific gmail thread using the original thread's subject, requiring a valid `thread id` and correctly formatted email addresses. supports attachments via the `attachment` parameter with valid `s3key`, `mimetype`, and `name`.
